thread.title: Oregon shooting sparks debate over Florida weapons bill

title: Oregon shooting sparks debate over Florida weapons bill
text:
Oregon shooting sparks debate over Florida concealed weapons bill Shooting sparks debate over Fl.'s concealed weapon bill Post to Facebook Oregon shooting sparks debate over Florida concealed weapons bill Shooting sparks debate over Fl.'s concealed weapon bill Check out this story on wtsp.com: http://on.wtsp.com/1RkX6iO Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Oregon shooting sparks debate over Florida concealed weapons bill Isabel Mascareñas, WTSP 4:09 p.m. EDT October 2, 2015 Rep. Greg Steube CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Sarasota, Florida -- Despite Oregon being one of 8 states allowing concealed weapons on college campuses, Umpqua Community College was a gun-free zone. The school's one security guard was unarmed. 
Thursday afternoon's school shooting ended with 10 dead and 7 injured. The Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives reportedly found 13 weapons belonging to the shooter: 6 at the school and 7 at his home. 
Oregon's shooting shines light on Florida House Rep. Greg Steube's bipartisan bill to allow concealed weapons on college and university campuses. 
"How many innocent people have to die till you realized gun-free zones are not the answer?" asks Steube, a Republican. Read or Share this story: http://on.wtsp.com/1RkX6iO TOP VIDEOS
